custom_css_main_element=”font-family: %22trashhand%22;” global_colors_info=”{}”]Hey there! Talking to an adult or whānau about porn can feel awkward 😬 so it’s great you’re keen to give it a go. [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”44a5c643-4e1c-4478-b397-266b3936250c” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”0px||||false|false” custom_padding=”23px|70px||35px|false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”|0px||0px|false|true” custom_padding_phone=”|0px|||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”18px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Believe it or not, most adults care about young people and are up for an honest convo, so it might be easier than you think – it just comes down to some planning 😉. Here’s some info that might help out… And big respect for giving it a go 👍🏽

Schooling up the oldies
Here’s a couple of great links for you to send to your parents/whānau to watch so they can get informed before any convo.
  • This Light Project Whānau resource gives some great info on how to prepare for a porn conversation, what to talk about and how to keep the convo open.
  • This great 2-minute animated clip by the Classification Office shows what NZ youth want their parents to know about porn.
  • These parent resources by the Classification Office give some helpful tips for parents
[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” background_position=”top_center” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#0a0a0a” text_font_size=”23px” text_letter_spacing=”-2px” text_line_height=”1.3em” background_enable_color=”off” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|7deg” text_orientation=”center” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: %22impact label%22″ global_colors_info=”{}”]Most porn was pretty low-key before the internet. “The majority, specifically boys, stumble upon porn at an early age. We’re talking primary school… or early high school. At that age, there’s really no one to talk to – and that’s the struggle.”
male, 17 yrs, OFLC survey

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/VHS-1024×744.png” title_text=”VHS” disabled_on=”on|off|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”body-text” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”0px||0px||false|false” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]
Porn in the dark age (pre-Internet)

Want to know what porn was like in your parent’s day and how it’s different to what’s online today 🤔?

There were three main differences:

  •  Amount 
    Playboy and Penthouse were the two biggest mags. Playboy had its most subscribers in 1972 … a whooping 7.6 million per year. Pornhub alone gets 115 million a day. There wasn’t much video either – in 1984 there were 400 porn videos made in the US, last year there were 6.8 million uploads, just to Pornhub.
  •  Access 
    To read or watch porn you used to rock up to a video store or dairy, show them your ID card (18+), and then spend a week’s pocket money buying a porn mag or hiring a porn video. Most families only had one device to watch it on… a big TV in the lounge, so yeah, privacy was a problem! Now it’s on your phone 24/7 – and free.
  •  Content 
    A lot of porn was pretty low key before the internet, there were actual storylines, romance and bodies were more normal (different sizes) – like they actually had pubic hair 😵. In general, it was more like ‘real-life’ sex compared to porn today.
[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text disabled_on=”on|off|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#090a09″ text_font_size=”25px” text_line_height=”1.3em” header_text_color=”#0a0a0a” text_orientation=”center” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘Impact Label’;” global_colors_info=”{}”]Playboy had its most subscribers in 1972… 7.6 million per year. Pornhub alone gets 115 million a day. Wow.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”25px” text_line_height=”1.2em” background_color=”#59848d” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|3deg” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”35px|20px|35px|20px|true|true” animation_direction=”left” link_option_url_new_window=”on” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” custom_css_after=” content: ”;|| position: absolute;||left: 0;|| top: 50%;|| width: 0;|| height: 0;|| border: 32px solid transparent;|| border-right-color: #59848d;|| border-left: 0;|| border-bottom: 0;|| margin-top: -10px;|| margin-left: -32px;||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

“It’s hard to admit you have a porn problem or to even say that it’s involved in your life. People want out of it so bad but it’s hard to find a normal way to say it to parents or anyone. It’s embarrassing and you feel like you have betrayed yourself and everything your mum and dad have brought you up to be.”
Anon youth, TLP Survey 2020

Want to talk with an adult
or your whanau about porn?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text disabled_on=”off|off|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#0a0a0a” text_font_size=”42px” text_line_height=”0.9em” custom_margin=”||||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”25px||28px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||36px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”37px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”center” text_orientation_phone=”” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Want to talk with an adult or your whanau about porn?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_image=”off” custom_padding=”||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][husk_laptop_video_slider _builder_version=”4.6.5″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][husk_laptop_video_slide heading=”Know it’s okay to have questions about porn?” video_url=”https://vimeo.com/580516770″ _builder_version=”4.6.5″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Young kiwis share their own questions and experiences around porn.

[/husk_laptop_video_slide][husk_laptop_video_slide heading=”What Young People Want From Whānau” video_url=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v_eAoMO16C8″ _builder_version=”4.5.6″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

This is a great clip with young New Zealanders thoughts on online porn, and what they wish adults knew. Send this to the adults you know.

[/husk_laptop_video_slide][husk_laptop_video_slide heading=”Why We Need To Talk About Porn” video_url=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TCY2dOf2eMs” _builder_version=”4.5.6″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]Jo Robertson does a fantastic TEDx for kiwi parents on why we need to talk about porn. Show it to all the adults in your life 😊. NZ campaign on keeping it real.

Funny clip where kids tell their mums the biggest lie they’ve ever said – and it’s not so bad.

[/husk_laptop_video_slide][husk_laptop_video_slide heading=”What’s The Biggest Lie You Ever told Your Dad?” video_url=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_8cXEqa78IQ” _builder_version=”4.5.6″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Funny clip where kids tell dads the worst thing they’ve ever done – and it’s not so bad.

HELP

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Text” module_class=”hover-box” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”7e82feb3-12e0-4a65-ab4f-8686eecc6966″ header_font=”||||||||” header_4_font=”||||||||” transform_scale_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_translate_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_rotate_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_skew_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_origin_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_styles_last_edited=”off|desktop” box_shadow_color=”#e1e2e3″ global_module=”3293″ saved_tabs=”all” global_colors_info=”{}” transform_styles__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_scale__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_translate__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_rotate__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_skew__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_origin__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_scale__hover=”103%|103%” box_shadow_color__hover=”rgba(10,10,10,0.62)”]

What’s up?

Whatsup helps young people with heaps of issues like dating, sex, porn, bullying or anxiety. Confidential online chat: 3 -10pm. Freephone counsellors 12-11pm weekdays and 3-11pm on weekends.

Freephone: 0800WHATSUP
www.whatsup.co.nz

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Text” module_class=”hover-box” _builder_version=”4.5.6″ _module_preset=”7e82feb3-12e0-4a65-ab4f-8686eecc6966″ header_font=”||||||||” header_4_font=”||||||||” transform_scale_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_translate_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_rotate_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_skew_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_origin_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_styles_last_edited=”off|desktop” box_shadow_color=”#e1e2e3″ global_module=”3295″ saved_tabs=”all” global_colors_info=”{}” transform_styles__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_scale__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_translate__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_rotate__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_skew__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_origin__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_scale__hover=”103%|103%” box_shadow_color__hover=”rgba(10,10,10,0.62)”]

YOUTHLINE

24/7 free service designed just for youth. You can call or text to talk about big or small stuff.

Anonymous online chat 7-10pm.
Freephone: 0800 376 633
Text: 234
www.youthline.co.nz

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Text” module_class=”hover-box” _builder_version=”4.5.6″ _module_preset=”7e82feb3-12e0-4a65-ab4f-8686eecc6966″ header_font=”||||||||” header_4_font=”||||||||” transform_scale_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_translate_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_rotate_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_skew_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_origin_last_edited=”off|desktop” transform_styles_last_edited=”off|desktop” box_shadow_color=”#e1e2e3″ global_module=”3284″ global_colors_info=”{}” transform_styles__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_scale__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_translate__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_rotate__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_skew__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_origin__hover_enabled=”on|desktop” transform_scale__hover=”103%|103%” box_shadow_color__hover=”rgba(10,10,10,0.62)”]

Aunty Dee

Awesome wellbeing tool that helps you work through any type of problem by guiding you through a series of questions that help you come up with ideas, solutions and connections to the right support.

www.auntydee.co.nz

excerpt.rendered: Want to talk with an Adult/WhānauAbout Porn?Hey there! Talking to an adult or whānau about porn can feel awkward 😬 so it’s great you’re keen to give it a go. Believe it or not, most adults care about young people and are up for an honest convo, so it might be easier than you think […]
